intro: Achyrocline flavescens, commonly known as the yellow achyrocline, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, often appearing in late summer to early autumn. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Achyrocline flavescens is also noted for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine.
